summary: Large ATLAS collaboration author list (~2900 authors) inflated ES score to 2780.1 despite only 12% title Jaccard similarity, causing false positive merge with unrelated sausage microbiology paper

incoming.title: A continuous calibration of the ATLAS flavour-tagging classifiers using R=0.4 jets in ttbar events

candidate.title: Modeling the growth of natural microbiota in Frankfurt-type sausages manufactured with bacteriocin-producing protective cultures

notes: Classic ATLAS-style failure mode. Title overlap is minimal (some shared common words like 'the', 'of', 'in'). The massive author list dominated the ES score. Current threshold allows Jaccard >= 0.3 for HIGH confidence when ES is high, but 0.12 is far below even that permissive threshold - yet the system still merged them due to ES score dominance.
